Eewaltz

A try at doing something for traditional Slavic, dreary waltzes. We're using a name convention "Eastern European Waltz" simply because "EE" is much shorter than "Russian"). This was written for "Dark Eyes". Note: For strumming we emulate a balalaika which has 3 strings. We using a EEA (Prima) tuning, but you can change this if you want.

  • EEWaltz
  • EEWaltzPlus
  • EEWaltzWalkPlus
  • EEWaltzSus
  • EEWaltzWalkSus
  • EEWaltzEnd

EEWaltz

A basic waltz for Slavic love tunes. (24)
Bass AcousticBass
Plectrum Koto

EEWaltzPlus

Lighten up on the chords and add in some random improve. (24)
Arpeggio Koto
Bass AcousticBass
Plectrum Koto

EEWaltzWalkPlus

Exchange regular bass for walking. (24)
Arpeggio Koto
Plectrum Koto
Walk AcousticBass

EEWaltzSus

Not quite a sustain since the accordion notes start just before beat 2. (24)
Bass AcousticBass
Chord-Sus Bandoneon
Plectrum Koto

EEWaltzWalkSus

Same sustain with a walking bass. (24)
Chord-Sus Bandoneon
Plectrum Koto
Walk AcousticBass

EEWaltzEnd

A 2 bar ending. (2)
Bass AcousticBass
Plectrum Koto
